verses.text: Concerning the Ammonites , thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*; Hath Israel no sons ? hath he no heir ? why \add then\add* doth their king inherit Gad , and his people dwell in his cities ?\f + \fr 49.1 \ft Concerning: or, Against\f*\f + \fr 49.1 \ft their king: or, Melcom\f*

Therefore, behold, the days come , saith the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, that I will cause an alarm of war to be heard in Rabbah of the Ammonites ; and it shall be a desolate heap , and her daughters shall be burned with fire : then shall Israel be heir unto them that were his heirs , saith the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*.

Howl , O Heshbon , for Ai is spoiled : cry , ye daughters of Rabbah , gird you with sackcloth ; lament , and run to and fro by the hedges ; for their king shall go into captivity , \add and\add* his priests and his princes together.\f + \fr 49.3 \ft their king: or, Melcom\f*

Wherefore gloriest thou in the valleys , thy flowing valley , O backsliding daughter ? that trusted in her treasures , \add saying\add*, Who shall come unto me?\f + \fr 49.4 \ft thy…: or, thy valley floweth away\f*

Behold, I will bring a fear upon thee, saith the Lord \nd \+w GOD|strong="H3069"\+w*\nd* of hosts , from all those that be about thee; and ye shall be driven out every man right forth ; and none shall gather up him that wandereth.
And afterward I will bring again the captivity of the children of Ammon , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*. \p
¶ Concerning Edom , thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of hosts ; \add Is\add* wisdom no more in Teman ? is counsel perished from the prudent ? is their wisdom vanished ?

Flee ye, turn back , dwell deep , O inhabitants of Dedan ; for I will bring the calamity of Esau upon him, the time \add that\add* I will visit him.\f + \fr 49.8 \ft turn…: or, they are turned back\f*
If grapegatherers come to thee, would they not leave \add some\add* gleaning grapes ? if thieves by night , they will destroy till they have enough.\f + \fr 49.9 \ft till…: Heb. their sufficiency\f*
But I have made Esau bare , I have uncovered his secret places , and he shall not be able to hide himself: his seed is spoiled , and his brethren , and his neighbours , and he \add is\add* not.
Leave thy fatherless children , I will preserve \add them\add* alive ; and let thy widows trust in me.

For thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*; Behold, they whose judgment \add was\add* not to drink of the cup have assuredly drunken ; and \add art\add* thou he \add that\add* shall altogether go unpunished ? thou shalt not go unpunished , but thou shalt surely drink \add of it\add*.

For I have sworn by myself, saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, that Bozrah shall become a desolation , a reproach , a waste , and a curse ; and all the cities thereof shall be perpetual wastes.

I have heard a rumour from the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and an ambassador is sent unto the heathen , \add saying\add*, Gather ye together , and come against her, and rise up to the battle.
For, lo, I will make thee small among the heathen , \add and\add* despised among men.

Thy terribleness hath deceived thee, \add and\add* the pride of thine heart , O thou that dwellest in the clefts of the rock , that holdest the height of the hill : though thou shouldest make thy nest as high as the eagle , I will bring thee down from thence, saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.
Also Edom shall be a desolation : every one that goeth by it shall be astonished , and shall hiss at all the plagues thereof.
As in the overthrow of Sodom and Gomorrah and the neighbour \add cities\add* thereof, saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, no man shall abide there, neither shall a son of man dwell in it.

Behold, he shall come up like a lion from the swelling of Jordan against the habitation of the strong : but I will suddenly make him run away from her: and who \add is\add* a chosen \add man, that\add* I may appoint over her? for who \add is\add* like me? and who will appoint me the time ? and who \add is\add* that shepherd that will stand before me?\f + \fr 49.19 \ft appoint me…: or, convent me in judgment?\f*

Therefore hear the counsel of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, that he hath taken against Edom ; and his purposes , that he hath purposed against the inhabitants of Teman : Surely the least of the flock shall draw them out : surely he shall make their habitations desolate with them.
The earth is moved at the noise of their fall , at the cry the noise thereof was heard in the Red sea.\f + \fr 49.21 \ft Red sea: Heb. Weedy sea\f*
Behold, he shall come up and fly as the eagle , and spread his wings over Bozrah : and at that day shall the heart of the mighty men of Edom be as the heart of a woman in her pangs. \p

¶ Concerning Damascus. Hamath is confounded , and Arpad : for they have heard evil tidings : they are fainthearted ; \add there is\add* sorrow on the sea ; it cannot be quiet.\f + \fr 49.23 \ft fainthearted: Heb. melted\f*\f + \fr 49.23 \ft on…: or, as on the sea\f*
Damascus is waxed feeble , \add and\add* turneth herself to flee , and fear hath seized on \add her:\add* anguish and sorrows have taken her, as a woman in travail.
How is the city of praise not left , the city of my joy !
Therefore her young men shall fall in her streets , and all the men of war shall be cut off in that day , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of hosts.
And I will kindle a fire in the wall of Damascus , and it shall consume the palaces of Ben-hadad. \p

¶ Concerning Kedar , and concerning the kingdoms of Hazor , which Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon shall smite , thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*; Arise ye, go up to Kedar , and spoil the men of the east.

Their tents and their flocks shall they take away : they shall take to themselves their curtains , and all their vessels , and their camels ; and they shall cry unto them, Fear \add is\add* on every side. \p

¶ Flee , get you far off , dwell deep , O ye inhabitants of Hazor , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*; for Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon hath taken counsel against you, and hath conceived a purpose against you.\f + \fr 49.30 \ft get…: Heb. flit greatly\f*

Arise , get you up unto the wealthy nation , that dwelleth without care , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, which have neither gates nor bars , \add which\add* dwell alone.\f + \fr 49.31 \ft wealthy: or, that is at ease\f*

And their camels shall be a booty , and the multitude of their cattle a spoil : and I will scatter into all winds them \add that are\add* in the utmost corners ; and I will bring their calamity from all sides thereof, saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.\f + \fr 49.32 \ft in…: Heb. cut off into corners, or, that have the corners of their hair polled\f*
And Hazor shall be a dwelling for dragons , \add and\add* a desolation for ever : there shall no man abide there, nor \add any\add* son of man dwell in it. \p
¶ The word of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* that came to Jeremiah the prophet against Elam in the beginning of the reign of Zedekiah king of Judah , saying ,
Thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of hosts ; Behold, I will break the bow of Elam , the chief of their might.
And upon Elam will I bring the four winds from the four quarters of heaven , and will scatter them toward all those winds ; and there shall be no nation whither the outcasts of Elam shall not come.

For I will cause Elam to be dismayed before their enemies , and before them that seek their life : and I will bring evil upon them, \add even\add* my fierce anger , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*; and I will send the sword after them, till I have consumed them:
And I will set my throne in Elam , and will destroy from thence the king and the princes , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*. \p
¶ But it shall come to pass in the latter days , \add that\add* I will bring again the captivity of Elam , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.
